title: Domaine de Colette 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)
description: A dense planting of old vines has yielding small quantities of concentrated fruit. This wine is dense, with a firm tannic character as well as bold blackberry fruits. It is rich and will age well. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Domaine des Capréoles 2016 L'Amourgandise Terroir de Lantignié  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: Swathes of ripe black fruits mark out this rich wine. Coming from the village of Lantignié, it is a cut above simple Beaujolais-Villages and that shows in the berry fruits, the wood aging and the balanced acidity. Drink this wine now.

title: Domaine des Pasquiers 2015 Sablet Red (Côtes du Rhône Villages)
description: Luscious black-cherry and raspberry flavors are straightforward and juicy in this voluptuous yet elegantly balanced red. It's a creamy, mouthfilling sip nuanced with hints of nuts and sage. The finish is moderately long and framed by ripe, sinewy tannins.

title: Château de Nages 2015 Vieilles Vignes White (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Savory notes of freshly tilled soil, dried oregano and sage penetrate into brighter tones of lemon and white peach. This is a soft, rounded wine with medium body and delicate acidity, but the finish is refreshingly mineral. Drink now through 2020.

title: Château d'Or et de Gueules 2015 Les Cimels White (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Pressed apples and pears are layered in honey and caramel in this dry white blend. While medium bodied in style, it has a soft, rippling mouthfeel accentuated by delicate acidity. A waxy honeycomb note lingers on the finish.

title: 786 Wines 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Good depth and concentration lift this medium-bodied and well-balanced wine well above the average. It has complex fruit flavors, light touches of vanilla and butter, and a velvety smooth texture supported by just enough acidity to keep it lively.

title: Ana 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This is a silky Pinot cloaked in fine, savory tannins and fresh acidity with stalky, cherry cola, red fruit and floral notes. There's a lovely tension in this wine that keeps you going back for more.

title: Arboleda 2015 Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Spicy berry, dry oak and herbal aromas are typical of Chilean Carmenère. This is a lively offering with kicking acidity that's on the high side. Spiced cherry and plum flavors are herbal and juicy due to the wine's acid level, while this tastes oaky and chocolaty on the finish.

title: Avensole 2013 Aventura Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)
description: There's an intriguing blend of candied cherry and rosewater reduction on the nose of this bottling, which includes 5% Syrah, along with sweet bay leaf and fennel. Red currants and cranberries show on the sip, lifted by caramelized sage and pepper dust.

title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 Domaine De La Chanaise  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: This ripe, smooth wine is rich and full of black-currant and black-cherry fruits. It is perfumed with just the right amount acidity to balance the richness. A blend from different parcels, the wine is delicious now and ready to drink.

title: Estrin 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Franc and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from Riverbend, this wine principally comes from Red Mountain Vineyard. The aromas are all high toned at present, with notes of vanilla, herb and exotic spice, not quite ready to reveal their charms. The red-fruit flavors are plump in feel, lingering on the finish.

title: Fietri 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this offers aromas of tobacco leaf, black-skinned berry and an earthy whiff of truffle. The structured palate delivers black plum, clove and a touch of cinnamon alongside pliant tannins.

title: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée J  (Juliénas)
description: This perfumed wine is rich in black-cherry fruit and has a generous, rounded texture and crisp acidity. Delicious already, it is smooth and ripe, ready to drink now.

title: Franco Conterno 2011 Pietrin  (Barolo)
description: New leather, grilled porcini, fig and charred soil aromas meld with balsamic notes. The forward, structured palate offers stewed prune, dried cherry and clove set against fine-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to soften then drink to capture the remaining fruit richness.

title: François Grenier 2016 Fragrance  (Saint-Joseph)
description: Fresh yellow peach, apple and pear notes are accented by bitter walnut skin and bramble in this bold, richly textured wine. While dry in style, hints of honey and blossom lend a perception of sweetness that lingers on the finish.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Château de Saint Amour  (Saint-Amour)
description: This wine is full of juicy fruit and a balanced structure of tannins. It is ripe yet shows a crisp edge of acidity. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 La Madone  (Fleurie)
description: Named after the small chapel that tops the hill behind the village of Fleurie, this wine is structured and firm. It has some fine tannins as well as plenty of juicy red-cherry fruits. It will be ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Henry Fessy 2016  Juliénas
description: This wine comes from a five-acre parcel planted on schist. The 50-year-old vines have produced a solid wine, perfumed with red cherries and flavored with rich berry and black-cherry fruit. The tannins are integrating well to give a wine that will be ready from late 2018.

title: Hoopes 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Coombsville)
description: Oaky, oily and robust, this white is moderate in acidity, offering a focused line of stone fruit that's fleshy and ripe.

title: Inspire Moore 2014 Wisdom Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Reticent at first, this opens up to dense aromas of blackberry, black cherry, moss and dried leaves. There's good tension and weight to the palate, yet the impression is lighter in feel than the nose suggests. Crunchy red berries and streaks of granite lead to a peppery, dry finish.

title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Belles Grives  (Morgon)
description: This wine is powerful, dense and has a solidly tannic structure. It also offers bold swathes of ripe red cherries and balanced acidity. The wine is almost ready to drink, just wait until mid-2018.

title: Jean Loron 2016 Au Beau Moulin  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Still very young, this wine that celebrates the windmill (Moulin-à-Vent) of the appellation is bright purple in color, full of boisterous cherry flavors and shows just the right amount of tannic structure. A small amount of oak aging gives a smooth edge to the wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Jean Loron 2016 Le Moulin  (Chiroubles)
description: Produced from vines planted on the cool, shallow-granite soil of Chiroubles, this wine is balanced, ripe and has some fine tannins. It is smoothly textured, generous with its acidity and red fruits and ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: La Ferme du Mont 2014 La Truffière White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: With aeration and time, initial whiffs of smoke and earth give way to fresher herb, lemon and lime. Rounded edges and plump texture accentuate this wine's full-bodied feel but lively citrus notes maintain freshness. The finish is moderately long and a tad warming. Drink now through 2019.

title: Lafond 2014 Pommard Clone Lafond Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a strong density of dark fruits on the nose of this clonal selection, along with muddy clay, crushed slate and fennel pollen. The palate is thick with boysenberry jam, star anise and vanilla, though the strong flavors are competing rather than collaborating.

title: Lois Rae 2015 Grenache (El Dorado)
description: Bright, fresh, fruity aromas and flavors are supported by a good firm texture in this very clean, tangy wine. It has a bracing mouthfeel, plenty of red cherry and raspberry flavors and light to medium body.

title: M. Chapoutier 2016 Belleruche Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Plush, plummy red-cherry and berry flavors mingle into smokier tones of anise and earth in this full-bodied red. It's approachably ripe yet crisply balanced, with a finish marked by firm, velvet-edged tannins.

title: Maimai 2014 Syrah (Hawke's Bay)
description: The nose on this distinctive Syrah is a mélange of beef teriyaki, aniseed, stewed raspberry and cherry aromas. Oak influence is marked, particularly on the palate, where the juicy red fruit notes and star anise are slightly overwhelmed by a dried bark finish. Nevertheless, this is a savory style many will enjoy.

title: Ormanni 2013 Borro del Diavolo Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with scents reminiscent of ripe plum, dark culinary spice, balsamic notes and a whiff of espresso. The austere palate is vibrant but a bit lean in terms of fruit richness, offering dried cherry, licorice and coffee bean framed in bright acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the finish. Give it a few more years to come around then drink.

title: OZV 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Oozing with blackberry jam aroma and flavor, this medium-bodied wine has a very rich, lightly sweet mouthfeel, tons of blackberry and boysenberry on the palate and a toasty, spicy, lingering finish.
